result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Lamar Bennett

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant James Lamar Bennett in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for James Lamar Bennett.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Hoffman asks for a status conference. State in agreement.
Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 11:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Lamar Bennett in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for James Lamar Bennett. 
State calls Austin Lauridsen- sworn and testifies. Responded to call of person standing in backyard of caller. Located defendant in area. Witness identifies defendant. Spoke to reporting party. Recites incidents.
Att Hoffman cross examines. Victims never told him to leave property or leave them alone.
State rests
Att Hoffman- no witnesses.
State moves for bind over
Court finds probable cause, bound over for arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Warrant was never sent due to defendant appearing at hearing 30 minutes after warrant was issued.

No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with their address or their property. No contact within close proximity to the property, specifically the yard of the residence.

$500.00 already posted, requires an additional $250 cash
No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with their address or their property. No contact within close proximity to the property, specifically the yard of the residence.

9:17 AM Defendant James Lamar Bennett not in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for James Lamar Bennett.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Hoffman- no information
State- requests warrant and bail forfeiture
Court notes he had notice, orders warrant and bail forfeited, Minnesota and Wisconsin

9:43 Reconvene with defendant present
Att Hoffman- client believed court was at 9:30
State requests bond reinstated with an additional $500
Att Hoffman- Client couldn't post additional cash
Court- State had witness here. Notes oral notification and written notification of 9:15 hearing. State had requested $2500 cash at initial appearance. Appears fairly promptly but will have to reschedule prelim.
Defendant- can't post anything extra. Has been working on himself.
Court order another $250 cash bail, will reinstate prior bail also. Warrant quashed
Defendant's demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with their address or their property. No contact within close proximity to the property, specifically the yard of the residence.
No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with their address or their property. No contact within close proximity to the property, specifically the yard of the residence.

1:38 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Lamar Bennett appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for James Lamar Bennett. Defendant's address confirmed. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $2500 cash. No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with the address in the complaint (2319 Oakes Ave, Superior). Recites defendant's previous criminal convictions and pending criminal cases. Notes there have been victims asking for no contact order. Asks for absolute no contact including no contact in the yard, garage, or on the sidewalk outside of the residence. Attorney Reid indicates that the defendant has 20 years of contact with the Twin Ports area, has a child extended family in the area. Notes that there does not to be any FTAs. No objections with no contact condition but asks for up to $500 cash or high signature bond. 

Court notes concerns over other pending criminal cases and concerns over defendant previously serving time in prison. Court orders $500 cash bail. $2000 signature bond. No contact with EJS and MES and no contact with their address or their property. No contact within close proximity to the property, specifically the yard of the residence.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
